Name: Melisa Navarrograduated4Geeks Academy
Title: Bootcamp Fullstack
Review:
Si estás buscando un bootcamp donde te lleven de la mano en cada paso, este no es para ti. Es un programa que exige mucha dedicación, especialmente si vienes de una rama totalmente distinta al desarrollo. Hay que investigar mucho por cuenta propia y comprometerse al 100% para realmente sacarle provecho.

Dicho esto, la escuela ofrece un gran apoyo. Hay muchas mentorías disponibles y el equipo está siempre dispuesto a ayudar. Hans, en particular, es un excelente profesor. Te exige, te motiva y te da el empujón necesario para que saques lo mejor de ti. Además, brinda mucho contexto sobre cómo es realmente el trabajo en la industria.

En cuanto a la búsqueda de empleo, la escuela te respalda muchísimo en todo el proceso. Pero quiero destacar especialmente a Melisa: es una genia en lo que hace. Si tienes la oportunidad de recibir su guía, aprovéchala al máximo.
En resumen, es un bootcamp desafiante pero muy valioso. Si estás dispuesto a esforzarte y comprometerte, vale totalmente la pena.Less

Name: Yoel Cabaleirograduated4Geeks Academy
Title: A year ago I didn't know how to code. Today I have a job.
Review:
4Geeks Academy presents a very well-designed FullStack bootcamp, in my opinion. It provides a fair amount of knowledge in several technologies that are heavily demanded in the market nowadays. It equips you with the proper tools to navigate the course with ease, allowing you to focus on what is important: learning. BUT, this is not a miraculous solution; it all depends on your dedication and time. You still need to learn A LOT on your own if you want to succeed quickly (I've been working on my programming skills almost like a full-time job since I started the bootcamp, and it took me 6 months after finishing it to land a job). Don't get me wrong: this is the same for every bootcamp. It's impossible to reach a professional level in programming in just 3 months by only attending classes. That being said, if you think you have the time and the strength, 4Geeks is just an amazing academy. Not only do they teach you the skills, but they also teach you how to keep learning. Also, I probably wouldn't have had this job opportunity if it weren't for the amazing career support they provide after the course. Now I know how to navigate this world, and that's just as valuable as the skills themselves.

I absolutely recommend you to check what they have to offer!Less

Name: Lucia Mackovastudent at4Geeks Academy
Title: Hard but worth it
Review:
I started the course in April and currently I am in the final phase, working with my team on the final project. It has been a roller coaster of emotions and feelings, but I would definitely do it again. 
Throughout the course we got support from both our teacher and the teacher assistant. You can ask for mentorship sessions to build up on certain things or, in case you did not understand something, to review. It is very important that you ask questions. Revise, read everything there is to read and attend those sessions. You can't just attend the classes and call it a day. You need to program outside of the scheduled classes as well and the more you do, the better for you. Every module has at least one project, which has several levels and you can add more functionalities. I always tried to personalize things to make them more interesting. Sky really is the limit! 
At the beginning things look very overwhelming and scary, but once you notice the pattern and you reflect upon your progress, you realize that it works. You just need to have faith in the course and the way things are done. Talk to your classmates, to your teachers. Don't believe what that little voice in your head is telling you. Everybody struggles, some people are doing the exercises faster, some people are slower. Some are better in one module, but completely suck at the other one. Just keep on coding, it will get easier after some time.
What I do definitely recommend is to reduce working hours when working on the final project. If you can, even take a vacation. Don't underestimate the task, you will need to code every single day and you most probably will face some technical issues which will require time.Less

Gracias a la metodología y los recursos que brindan, me motivaron muchísimo a aprender y desarrollar mis habilidades a profundidad.
El apoyo que te brinda 4Geeks tanto mis profesores Oscar Miras y Sergio Araujo, como Victor Gómez, Marco Gómez y Ehiber Graterol es esencial, siempre están dispuestos a cualquier cosa que necesites y que la motivación y las ganas de aprender no se vayan nunca.
El bootcamp me ofreció mucho más que aprender a programar, me permitió entrar en un entorno donde el trabajo en equipo y la colaboración es fundamental. Aprendí a comunicarme, compartir ideas y trabajar en proyectos con mis compañeros de clase.
Unirme al bootcamp fue algo que influeció mucho mi vida y me hizo dar cuenta de que la programación y la tecnología es una pasión que no había tenido mucho en cuenta. 
Gracias a la academia y al bootcamp, tuve la oportunidad de tener una visión más clara  sobre lo que quería estudiar en la universidad y llevar a cabo a lo largo de mi vida, por lo que finalmente decidí estudiar Ingeniería Informática.Less

Name: Ramiro García Pereiragraduated4Geeks Academy
Title: Great Overall Experience!
Review:
I really recommend this course to anyone who wants to get started in the world of programming, especially to those who have 0 previous knowledge in the subject.
The selection of technologies, the very good teachers that the program has and the organization of the topics in terms of complexity and learning curve, are very well balanced.
Being a student of the Full-Time mode, I can say that it requires absolute willingness and exclusive dedication during the entire training time, there is no other way, it is necessary to make the sacrifice, but the result is unobjectionable, one really acquires the basic skills necessary to develop at the end of the course a complete basic Full-Stack project, which indicates a first big step towards the goal of becoming a professional developer.
Overall, 4Geeks delivers what it promises, giving you the initial basic tools to become a Full-Stack programmer, but here is a caveat, once you finish the training program, you have to continue studying, learning new technologies and making projects, but this will happen in any other bootcamp or even once you graduate from an IT university career.
What big technologies you will learn?
Backend: Basic Flask/Python, FrontEnd: Basic React with Hooks(No useReducer, no Redux)/Bootstrap 5, FullStack Deployment with RenderLess

Name: Jorge Luis Pardo Rodríguezgraduated4Geeks Academy
Title: An amazing alternative for starting out in the world of programming
Review:
For the past 16 weeks, I have been learning how to completely develop a web application at 4Geeks, and I have really enjoyed it.

In the first weeks of the course, we covered the basics of front-end development (html, css, javascript, and react), as well as complementary technologies required for working in an office environment (git, command line, etc).

Subsequently, the training focused on interacting with APIs, before creating one with SQLAlchemy, Python, and Flask. As well, we learned how to limit access to the API information.

The last part of the course was a four-week final project that consisted of building a complete web application that put all the knowledge learned in the course to the test through a stream on the academy's YouTube channel.

In each class, we had a teacher and an assistant who taught us the bases to carry out the exercises of the program meticulously. I have also benefited from unlimited mentoring provided by the school, which helped me to strengthen my knowledge and resolve any doubts I had throughout the bootcamp.

Title: Encouraging Community to Learn and Grow
Review:
Before you officially start the program, they give you pre-work that consists mainly HTML & CSS. I had exposure to HTML and CSS before starting the boot camp which did help me a little. So if you want to learn a little about HTML and CSS before starting the program it’s always helpful but not a necessity.

You’re going to learn a LOT. Don’t feel discouraged if you don’t feel ready enough in one area when the program progresses to another concept. The 4Geeks community is really helpful and kind, they’ll help you with anything. They have mentors you can schedule sessions with to help you with assignments or questions that you have. Everyone there wants you to succeed. Once you’re a part of the 4Geeks family, you’re there forever.

With any bootcamp or learning resource, it’s really about the time and energy you put into something. There are tons of exercises and projects that they have for you, as well as class instruction where you work on projects in class. Don't be shy to ask for help! They really do encourage you to schedule mentoring sessions and may even have "study group" sessions once a week with a TA to help with the current assignments you're working on. Take advantage of the resources available!

Unrelated to the boot camp, one advice I keep seeing and hearing is when you learn enough to build a simple project, build, build, build! You’ll have plenty to build within the program, but in general always keep building and using Google for what you know. I always think I understand something until I start building lol so applying your knowledge is key!Less

Their curriculum is truly what first got my attention! It was full-stack and involved python. Next, was the price of the Bootcamp. It was important to me that I found a good curriculum that was worth the value that they offered. After meeting with one of the founders, I realized they were the fit for me and immediately applied. They had the best value for the syllabus that I was looking for.
From the beginning, they offered an endless amount of support for any type of question that I had. This was important to me because I am enrolled in the part-time cohort and was not able to see them every day. Their communication is incomparable to other courses I have tried. Outstanding to say the least. Since I have started, I have not been disappointed. I have learned so much in the past 12 weeks (of 16) and am so proud of my progress. I graduate in September and am looking forward to the job support they have promised me. I am confident that they will help me succeed even after I have graduated and moved into my career.Less
